page.title: 11Housing
page.content: { Ingleton},the largest village in this area ,consists mainly of stone built houses with red pantile roofs or tiles.The village is{linear},the houses being built along the{Staindrop {to Darlington Road}.Two groups of colour_washed council houses were built in Gainford Road and Manor Road after the war. The oldest house in Ingleton is {Hillside}built in 1627 before the fire of London.It was a stone built farm house, but in 1912 the farm was split into three separate farms and the house was left empty for several years when a new modern Hillside farm house was built. Recently Hillside has been modernised and renovated. Other old houses in Ingleton are:_ {Greencroft }1695 { Ivy Cottage}1683
